Red Sox 12, Rays 2

Ellsbury may miss 6-8 weeks

Jacoby Ellsbury has a dislocated, or at least partially dislocated, shoulder and will miss 6-8 weeks, baseball sources are saying. (Boston Globe)
  • Sox rout Rays  |  Finn: Sox find comforts of home

Pictures: Fenway’s 100th season begins

Jacoby Ellsbury (right) was injured in a double play in the bottom of the fourth inning by Reid Brignac of the Tampa Bay Rays. Elsa/Getty images
Ellsbury grabbed his right shoulder after the collision, and the Red Sox took the center fielder out of the game. John Tlumacki/Globe Staff
Ryan Sweeney got a hit in the eighth inning, during which the Red Sox scored eight runs in the 12-2 win over the Rays. Elsa/Getty Images
Josh Beckett was still strong in the eighth inning as he pitched to the Rays' Evan Langoria. John Tlumacki/Globe Staff
Darnell McDonald reached high for the ball in the first inning of the home opener. Elsa/Getty Images
David Ortiz hit a single in the third inning, driving in a run to put the Sox up 3-1. John Tlumacki/Globe staff
Tampa Bay Rays starting pitcher David Price delivered against the Boston Red Sox. Jessica Rinaldi/Reuters
This little Red Sox fan, TJ Gonick, took in the sights with his dad Travis, as the Red Sox kicked off their 100th season at Fenway Park. Globe Staff / Bill Greene
Despite the team's early struggles, fans were in a celebratory mood. These fans marked the park's centennial with a homemade sign. Barry Chin/Globe staff
The Boston Red Sox lined up for the national anthem during the home opener. Elsa / Getty Images
  • Video Home opener  |  Pictures The scene  |  The game

Senator Brown, wife not hurt in accident

US Senator Scott Brown and his wife, former WCVB-TV reporter Gail Huff, were involved in a minor accident in Dedham as passengers Friday night. (Globe)

Romney files extension for 2011 taxes

The GOP candidate for president and former Mass. governor estimated his 2011 tax liability at $3.2 million, according to the extension filing. (Boston Globe)
  • PDF Read a copy of Romney's extension application
  • Obama paid a federal tax rate of 20.5 percent in 2011

Three dead, including police officer, in drug raid on Greenland, N.H. home

The man who shot five police officers, including Police Chief Michael Maloney (left), was found dead inside a home with a woman who was there when officers tried to execute a drug warrant. (Boston Globe)

Health & Wellness

Quiz

What do you know about
Lyme disease?

While most ticks and tick bites are harmless, ticks can carry infection. The most common infection in the US, and the one we see here in the Northeast, is Lyme disease.
